speaker: Skyline
text: The full yellow moon rises over the skyline.  _ACT ONE  Scene One - Restaurant Frasier is sat at a table in a crowded restaurant.  Several waiting diners are standing around, glaring at him.  His cell phone rings._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?  Niles, you're forty minutes late!  Listen, I've just finished my third basket of bread, and there is an angry mob breathing down my neck.  What?  Oh, you've torn your trouser cuff, I'm _so sorry_.  For God's sakes, will you hurry it up! More hemming, less hawing!  All right, I'll hold our table. _Roz comes in wearing a slinky evening dress, accompanied by her new boyfriend, Luke._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, Roz Doyle!

speaker: Roz
text: [_to Luke_] I'll be right back. [_goes over to Frasier, nervous_] Hi, Frasier.  I'm on a date, please don't screw it up.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I won't.  Niles is running a little late, and I-I was just hoping maybe I could join you and your lucky chap for a drink while I wait for him?

speaker: Roz
text: I-I really don't think so, it's kind of a romantic evening, and-

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, this crowd is starting to get ugly, would you please just let me come over there till Niles gets here, please?

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, all right!  Come on.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you. _Roz goes to join Luke.  As soon as Frasier moves, people start to look at his table.  He hurriedly takes off his jacket, drapes it over his chair, and sweeps the room with the protective glare of a lioness guarding her cubs (that's how he would describe it, anyway).  He sits with Luke and Roz._  [_N.B. Gary Cole appeared in "In The Line Of Fire" with John Mahoney._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi.

speaker: Roz
text: Luke Parker, Frasier Crane, he's joining us for a quick drink.

speaker: Luke
text: Oh, great!  I've heard your show, nice to meet you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, likewise.  So, uh, well, how did you two kids meet?

speaker: Luke
text: Actually I just moved to Seattle a month ago.  I live on a boat, and as I was pulling into the sloop, Roz was standing right there on the dock.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right there on the dock, you say?  Well...

speaker: Roz
text: I do live next to the marina!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, yes, yes, yes.  So Luke, you're a boat enthusiast?

speaker: Luke
text: You know anything about boats?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well actually, on my show I sometimes compare the human psyche to a sailboat that's borne along the surface of the conscious mind, while the deeper waters of the subconscious navigate the rudder.

speaker: Luke
text: So I guess the answer would be "no."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, my babysitter!  I'll be right back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right, of course.

speaker: Luke
text: So...

speaker: Frasier
text: So... you know, uh, actually I'm-I'm not a total stranger to the old H20.  I did row Crew at Harvard.

speaker: Luke
text: I went to Harvard!

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Harvard.  Mmm, God, those were the best years of my life. You know, there's nothing quite like that sense of accomplishment you get when they actually hand you that diploma, is there?

speaker: Luke
text: I dropped out.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you didn't miss much.

speaker: Luke
text: I just got frustrated reading about other people's experiences and never having any of my own.  So I dropped out, I built my own boat, and sailed around the world.  Yeah, sometimes there's more adventure than I bargained for.  Like, uh, twenty-foot seas off the Hebrides, or the time pirates rammed my boat and robbed me at gunpoint.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yeah, those guys can be pretty rough.

speaker: Luke
text: Oh, you've had experience with pirates?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I, uh, saw a special once on "60 Minutes."  You know, you should really write down some of these stories.

speaker: Luke
text: Yeah, I've thought about it, but I'm not much of a writer.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't let that stop you.  All you got to do is just get it down on paper, then sort it out later.  You know, I'd be happy to lend a critical eye.

speaker: Luke
text: Thanks.  Might take you up on that.

speaker: Frasier
text: OK.

speaker: Roz
text: I have to go, Alice got a bead stuck up her nose.  There's got to be some way to baby-proof her nostrils!  I'm sorry, Luke, we have to go.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I-I could drop him off.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, Frasier, that's very nice, but-

speaker: Luke
text: No, no, it's fine.  You go take care of Alice and, uh, I'll hang out with Frasier.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah well, don't you have to meet Niles?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, he's had a tailoring emergency, it could be hours.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I'll call you tomorrow, Luke.

speaker: Luke
text: OK.

speaker: Roz
text: Bye.

speaker: Luke
text: Bye, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: [_whispering_] He thinks I'm thirty-one and I was in a Whitesnake video.  _Roz kisses Frasier on the cheek and leaves.  FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Apartment - Kitchen Daphne and Martin are in the kitchen, cleaning fish.  Frasier comes in. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Hey Dad, welcome home.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Fras!  Didn't hear you come in.

speaker: Frasier
text: How was the fishing trip?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, it was great.  The worst day of fishing beats the best day of working.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, now that you've proven it, can we take the sign out of the bathroom? _They go out into the living room.  As Martin settles into his armchair, Frasier pours himself a sherry._

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, uh, Fras, you had a phone call a little while ago.  Some guy by the name of Lou, or maybe-

speaker: Frasier
text: Luke.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, Luke, that's it, yeah.  Said he'd call back later.  Real friendly guy, who is he?

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz's new boyfriend.  They're getting quite serious, and actually he and I have hit it off as well.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Actually, it is.  You know, with Niles spending more time with Daphne, I-I don't have anybody to pal around with.  And he's a really interesting guy.  He sails around the world, locating shipwrecks and salvaging treasure.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh!

speaker: Frasier
text: God, you know, he tells some incredible stories!  Yeah, it's refreshing, really - usually I'm the cool friend.

speaker: Martin
text: [_biting his tongue_] Sounds a little free-wheeling for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, really?  Well, he's planning to salvage a French trader off the coast of British Columbia next, and he's invited me along.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that should be fun.  You need a Dramamine patch just to get into the bathtub.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello!  Behold, the prodigal pup returns!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh-ho, look who's here!  Come on, boy!

speaker: Martin
text: [_cuddling_] Yeah, there you go, oh yeah.  Thanks for taking care of him while I was gone, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: You're quite welcome.

speaker: Martin
text: It was very thoughtful of you, unlike some people I know!

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, it was absolutely essential that I have my floors refinished, thanks to Edward Scissor-Paws there!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh thank you, Niles. [_into phone_] Hello?  Yes, this is Frasier Crane.  What?  I never touched your wife!  Never!  But I've never even heard of... oh Luke, [_laughs_] you got me again! You know, that's six to one!  I did so get one! _Frasier goes to his room.  Daphne comes out of the kitchen, still wearing her bloody apron and dishrags._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, my love.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh I'm sorry, I must look a mess.  I've been cleaning fish all afternoon.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh please, your beauty cannot be obscured by mere entrails, [_looks her over_] or scales, or... is that an eye?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll go wash up. [_gives him a kiss_]

speaker: Niles
text: If you like.

speaker: Martin
text: Hope Eddie wasn't a lot of trouble.

speaker: Niles
text: Please Dad, he was the perfect houseguest.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, give me the details.  Did he eat?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, like a horse!

speaker: Martin
text: Slept well?

speaker: Niles
text: Like a log!

speaker: Martin
text: Was he regular?

speaker: Niles
text: We're done here, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Just want you to know I really appreciate what you did for me.

speaker: Niles
text: Please, it was my pleasure.  I'm really gonna miss the little guy.  We actually started to bond.

speaker: Martin
text: Ha-ha, that's great.

speaker: Martin
text: [_noticing_] What's this tag?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, uh, that's nothing.  That's, uh, they put that on at the park.

speaker: Martin
text: [_reading_] "Bark Avenue?"  That's a kennel!  You dumped him off at a kennel?!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, Dad, actually it's more of a spa than a kennel.

speaker: Martin
text: I trusted you with Eddie and you betrayed that trust!  Why'd you do it, son?

speaker: Niles
text: Well Dad, it took Italian artisans three weeks to stain my Venetian umbrella stand and it took Eddie about twenty seconds!

speaker: Martin
text: [_getting up_] If I wanted him in a kennel I would have put him in one myself!

speaker: Niles
text: Well Dad, uh, I'm sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, so am I.  Come on, Eddie, I'll give you a bath. Who knows what you picked up in that flea trap!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, it was a lot nicer than that place you made us stay at Yellowstone!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: I need a drink and I need it fast!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll get the sherry.

speaker: Roz
text: Don't waste your time, I've got grown-up problems! _She rushes past him into the kitchen.  When he gets there she is pouring a glass full of expensive scotch._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, the twenty-five year-old Glen Farcas.  Excellent choice, no sense going for the twelve-year old stuff.

speaker: Roz
text: Luke's a slime bag!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, what happened?

speaker: Roz
text: I saw him sitting in a cafe with his arms around some blonde. They were all over each other!  I told him off, and we're through.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm so sorry, Roz. [_hugs her_]

speaker: Roz
text: I really liked him.

speaker: Frasier
text: I know.

speaker: Roz
text: And I thought he liked me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  Gosh, you know, I just got off the phone with him.  He didn't even mention it!  He can't possibly think I'd still be his friend after he treated you this way.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, I'm really glad to hear you say that, Frasier.  I mean, you were my friend first.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course.  Oh come on, [_hugs her again_] I'll get you through this.

speaker: Roz
text: [_sniffles a little_] Thank you, Frasier.  You know what?  I'm feeling better already. [_notices her drink_] Oh, maybe I don't even need this. _She throws the scotch into the sink, causing Frasier to gasp. She walks out of the kitchen as he stares, aghast, into the drain.  FADE TO:  Scene Three - Boat Luke is sitting in the salon of his boat, reading over some notes. Up on the deck, Frasier tries to drop a parcel on the step and leave, but it clatters down the stairs, causing Luke to look up._

speaker: Luke
text: Frasier? [_Frasier comes down_] What are you doing?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, I was just returning your "Chapman's Nautical Guide" there.  Uh, I-I just wanted to drop it off, actually.

speaker: Luke
text: Without saying hello?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I had a talk with Roz.

speaker: Luke
text: Oh, I see.  Well look, if it makes any difference, that woman was an old girlfriend.  She came to town, invited me to lunch, we ordered martinis, and the next thing you know, she was all over me!  You know how it is.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_covering_] Of course, I mean... But Roz is my friend. Take care.

speaker: Luke
text: [_shakes his hand_] You too, Frasier.

speaker: Luke
text: By the way-

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm?

speaker: Luke
text: Thanks for your advice.  I, uh, I started writing down some of those stories.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh?

speaker: Luke
text: Yeah, I wrote the one about the pirates, and the South American one.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh great, don't forget the one about the giant squid!

speaker: Luke
text: That was just a joke.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Gosh, you did it again, didn't you?  Oh, you know, I'm gonna miss that.  Ah, see you around.

speaker: Frasier
text: Say Luke, uh, you know, here's a tip: you might try writing in the present tense.  It has a way of giving things a sense of urgency.

speaker: Luke
text: That's great!  I'll try it.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_thoughtful_] Of course, if you hadn't been so thoughtless, we'd be heading for that sushi bar right now and be reviewing those notes.

speaker: Luke
text: Yeah, and that waitress would be there.  I think she likes you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_chuckles_] Oh, she does not.

speaker: Luke
text: You know what's ironic?

speaker: Frasier
text: Hmm?

speaker: Luke
text: If I had met you separately from Roz, this wouldn't even be an issue.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, it wouldn't.  You know, the truth is our friendship does exist independently of her.

speaker: Luke
text: That's true.  I mean, if you take Roz out of the equation, does our friendship disappear?

speaker: Frasier
text: It shouldn't.  Of course, for Roz's sake, we'll have to keep this between ourselves.

speaker: Luke
text: No need to rub it in her face.

speaker: Frasier
text: Agreed.  But, uh, for the record, I do not condone your behavior.

speaker: Luke
text: I wouldn't expect you to.

speaker: Frasier
text: I hope they haven't run out of Yellowtail.  _They laugh and head out together.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO_  **A DOUBLE LIFE**  _Scene Four - Apartment Frasier and Roz have finished a casual dinner together._

speaker: Roz
text: Well, thanks for dragging me out of the house.  It's been a rough week, and it sure helps to have a friend like you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah.  Roz, trust me, you will eventually get over Luke.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, he's not having any trouble getting over me.  I saw him leaving his boat last night with someone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  Did you, uh, get a good look at them?

speaker: Roz
text: Only from behind.  Some fat chick.

speaker: Frasier
text: Fat?  Well, it was kind of cold out last night, there may have been layers involved.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, layers of fat. [_checks her watch_] Frasier, it's getting so late, I should go!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, uh, right, OK.

speaker: Roz
text: [_getting her things_] Thanks for listening.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: You ever see me falling for some creep like that again, smack me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't give it another thought.  You know, I think he's not worth it, all right?

speaker: Roz
text: Good night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Good night.

speaker: Frasier
text: Luke?  It's Fras.  Yeah, uh, listen, I'm free, and I thought maybe I'd swing by.  We can, uh, go over and catch Marsalis at the jazz cafe, because "thar he blows!" [_laughs_] No, no, it just came to me.  All right, Luke, I'll see you soon, bye. [_hangs up_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Some friend you are!  How can you be with that rutting pig after what he did?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't see what's so wrong about being friends with Roz's ex-boyfriend!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, if you think there's nothing wrong with it, why are you hiding it from Roz?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, because I, um, uh- [_Martin comes out_] Dad!  A man has a right to choose his own friends, doesn't he?

speaker: Martin
text: Sure!  'Course, I think you're a rotten Judas for stabbing Roz in the back this way.

speaker: Frasier
text: You hear that?  He said "sure!"  _Daphne gives him a look.  He leaves.  FADE TO:  Scene Five - Caf e Nervosa Frasier is sat at the table by the window, with a small gift box.  Niles comes in._

speaker: Niles
text: Guess what I have?  Two tickets to the Orpheus Chamber Orchestra!

speaker: Frasier
text: The Orpheus!  Oh Niles, nobody handles Handel like they handle Handel! [_they laugh_] But wouldn't you rather take Daphne?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, she wouldn't enjoy it.  I took her to the opera last week. Halfway through _"Das Rheingold"_ she fell asleep.

speaker: Frasier
text: Astonishing!

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, well, it gets worse.  She snorted in her sleep, and startled Wotan, causing him to drop his spear on an unsuspecting gnome.  So, are you free tonight?

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh Niles, I'm sorry, I've got plans with Luke.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh yes, your much-ballyhooed new best friend.  Is that who the gift is for?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, no, no, this is for Roz.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, a guilt offering!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I suppose there's some truth to that.  You know, frankly I'm torn.  Part of me thinks I should tell her, but I just know it would devastate her.  She's a broken woman.

speaker: Luke
text: [_as they break_] I'm glad I bumped into you yesterday.

speaker: Roz
text: And twice this morning.

speaker: Luke
text: Buy you coffee?

speaker: Roz
text: Sure.

speaker: Roz
text: [_gasps_] Oh my God, Frasier's in there!  He can't see us, I don't want him to know we're back together!

speaker: Luke
text: Oh, I don't think he'd really have a problem-

speaker: Roz
text: No, you don't know him.  He's been very supportive, and if he sees us together again, he'll just think I'm weak!  Which I am.

speaker: Niles
text: Come on, there are no pirates!

speaker: Frasier
text: Sure there are!  Luke was pillaged!

speaker: Niles
text: That is so cool!

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, guys.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh hi, Roz.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Roz.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_she sits down_] I have a little something for you. [_gives her the box_]

speaker: Roz
text: For me?  Oh, what's the occasion?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, why do I need an occasion, Roz?  I'm just trying to show a good friend that I'm thinking of her in her time of crisis.

speaker: Roz
text: [_guilty_] Oh, Frasier, I don't deserve your friendship.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I do not deserve your friendship.

speaker: Niles
text: I deserve my own table, excuse me.

speaker: Roz
text: You know what?  I'm gonna take you out to dinner tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Tonight?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes, you've been so great about this whole Luke thing. I mean, the least I can do is buy you a meal.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right, Roz, I accept. [_takes out his cell phone_] Uh, would you excuse me?

speaker: Roz
text: Sure.

speaker: Frasier
text: Luke-o, F-Man. [_Niles's ears prick up_] Yeah, listen, uh, something's come up tonight and I won't be able to make it, all right?  Great, bye.

speaker: Frasier
text: So Roz, where would you like to go tonight?  Chez Henri has the most splendid ox-tail suree-

speaker: Roz
text: Excuse me. [_answers_] Hello?  Oh, hi.  Just a sec. [_to Frasier_] I really need to take this.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, Luke. [_Niles looks up again_] Oh damn, I just made plans... Well, if you put it that way, how can I say no?  I'll see you at eight, OK.

speaker: Roz
text: Bad news, Frasier.  My babysitter's all booked up, so can we rearrange dinner?

speaker: Frasier
text: What a shame. [_takes out his phone_] Excuse me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yeah Luke, it's Fras again.  Listen, um, my plans just got canceled and I was thinking maybe we could... oh, really? Well, that's-that's kind of quick, wasn't it? [_Niles nods to himself_] Well, no problem.  All right, yeah, I'll talk to you tomorrow, bye.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, this is the bracelet I wanted!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I remembered.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, you're such a good friend.  You're so caring and thoughtful and... loyal.  I got to make a phone call, I'll be right back!

speaker: Roz
text: Luke, it's Roz again.  Bad news...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_as Niles goes by_] Oh Niles, listen, as it turns out I am available for that concert tonight-

speaker: Niles
text: No you're not.  _He exits, leaving Frasier confused.  FADE TO:_  **WITH APOLOGIES TO MR. VONNEGUT**  _Scene Six - Apartment Frasier comes out in his jacket.  Daphne is dressed in a somewhat billowing evening dress._ [_N.B. Here are the first obvious signs of Jane Leeves's pregnancy; she definitely fills out the dress, and her cheeks are glowing._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Going out with Luke, I suppose?

speaker: Frasier
text: As a matter of fact, I'm having dinner with Roz.  And I will have a clear conscience, because first I am going to stop by Luke's and end our friendship.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I guess our little chat had an impact.

speaker: Frasier
text: So it did.

speaker: Daphne
text: Imagine that - me giving advice to a psychiatrist.  Maybe I should be on the radio and you should do the laundry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, what a merry time of misrule that would be. _He opens the door to Niles, carrying two parcels: one that's small and daintily wrapped, and one that's large and wrapped in brown paper._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh Niles, what are you doing here?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm taking Daphne to the concert.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, he said he'd rather go with me than anyone else.

speaker: Frasier
text: Indeed. Well, sweet dreams.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, sweetie.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.  This is for you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, truffles, [_kisses him_] my favorite!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you are so sweet, you say that about everything I bring.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh Daph, you look great.

speaker: Daphne
text: Thanks.

speaker: Martin
text: [_frosty_] Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I know you're still peeved about me taking Eddie to the spa-

speaker: Martin
text: [_not stopping_] Kennel.

speaker: Niles
text: Anyway, I-I brought a little peace offering-

speaker: Martin
text: Bribe.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, it's from Smokey Mountain Farms!

speaker: Niles
text: Five different meats in one big box!

speaker: Martin
text: [_disbelieving_] Not the "Slaughterhouse Five."

speaker: Niles
text: They don't make a Slaughterhouse Three.

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, I'm so sorry.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh well, I was disappointed, but-

speaker: Niles
text: I don't want you to think you can't trust me.  I will never let you down again.

speaker: Martin
text: Well thanks, Niles. Listen, I'm taking Eddie out for a walk. Why don't you come along, we can shoot the breeze.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, uh...

speaker: Daphne
text: [_mouth full_] Go on, I need a few more minutes to get ready. [_unwraps another_]

speaker: Niles
text: Well, uh, once around the block.

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, Eddie.

speaker: Daphne
text: Take your time!

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, thanks for not holding a grudge.  I know how much Eddie means to you.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, I forgot my jacket.  Here, [_hands Niles the parcel_] hold on to this, put the leash on him and I'll be right back.

speaker: Niles
text: All right, all right. _Martin goes back inside.  Niles bends down to attach the leash to Eddie's collar.  The elevator comes, full of people._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, uh, it's all right, I'm waiting for someone. _Someone pushes a button.  Just as the elevator doors close, Eddie bolts from Niles's grasp and onto the car.  Niles throws himself against the doors, frantically pushing the button, whispering urgent prayers of "stop!", "come back!", etc.  The doors open again, and someone hands Eddie back to him._

speaker: Niles
text: [_breathless_] Thank you, thank you.  It's OK, it's OK...

speaker: Niles
text: Come on, slowpoke!  _Martin smiles and follows him.  FADE TO:  Scene Seven - Boat Roz comes down the stairs into the empty salon._

speaker: Roz
text: Luke?  Surprise, it's Roz!  Luke?  Luke, are you home?  I got an hour to kill before dinner.  _She looks around, then picks up a pen and starts to write a note, then hears voices from outside._

speaker: Luke
text: [_o.s._] Come on board, I'll pour you a drink.

speaker: Woman
text: [_o.s._] You really live here?  I think boats are so sexy. _Roz desperately looks around for a place to hide, sees a large closet, flings it open - and shrieks when she sees Frasier standing there._

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: What are you doing here?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I stopped by to see Luke, I heard you coming, and I came inside and hid-

speaker: Luke
text: [_o.s._] Watch your step. _Roz shushes Frasier and jumps into the closet with him.  As they close the doors, Luke comes in with a blond woman.  Inside the closet, the following is conducted in whispers:_

speaker: Roz
text: After everything he did to me, you stayed friends with him, didn't you?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you started seeing him again without telling me! _Through the slats in the door, they see Luke put on romantic music and sit down with his date._

speaker: Luke
text: You have the most incredible eyes.

speaker: Roz
text: That bastard!  He told me I had the most incredible eyes!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, Roz, we can't let him know we're here!

speaker: Woman
text: What are all these pages?

speaker: Luke
text: Oh, writing a book.  But I'm having a little trouble... maybe you could be my inspiration.

speaker: Frasier
text: That bastard!  He told me I was his inspiration!

speaker: Roz
text: Shh!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sighs_] We may as well make ourselves comfortable.

speaker: Roz
text: I guess I should have told you we got back together.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I should apologize, actually.  After the way he treated you, I shouldn't have been hanging around with him.

speaker: Roz
text: You liked him.

speaker: Frasier
text: Truth be told, I don't really make friends very often. In fact, the last true friend I made was you.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yuck.

speaker: Frasier
text: Too much?

speaker: Roz
text: No, I'm sitting in something wet.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, just get up.

speaker: Roz
text: I can't, I'm caught on something.

speaker: Frasier
text: Here, all right, give me your hand. _He takes hold of her and yanks her up.  Suddenly there is the hissing of an air pump and something rises into the camera in front of them._

speaker: Roz
text: Uh-oh... _A split-second later the closet bursts open and the inflatable dinghy ejects Frasier and Roz into the salon, surprising Luke and his date._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_taking the offensive_] You've got a lot of explaining to do!
